item.description:
Please join South Shore Social Networkers and members of the Braintree Area Community as we gather to help start Habitat for Humanity's Braintree Area Local Partnership Committee (LPC)!  We have built 4 homes in Braintree and are organizing a Local Partnership Committee (LPC) in anticipation of another Braintree or local build in the Braintree area.

Join us for our August monthly Community Meeting!  We now meet the 2nd Wednesday of the month @ the Braintree Community Youth Center.

We will spend some time at tonight's Community Meeting discussing upcoming events and ways to help.  After our Community Meeting we will break out into Committee Meetings (primarily Outreach/Communications, Fundraising and Faith Relations).  Please join us to meet your Leadership Team, Committee Members and Neighbors at our monthly Community Meeting!

This is an exciting opportunity for those who want some hands-on experience with Habitat for Humanity, even if not actually lifting a hammer to physically build a home for a family. The Local Partnership Committee (LPC) participates in lots of behind the scenes activities and brings the community together. This is a great way to utilize your skills, meet neighbors, help spread the word about Habitat for Humanity work together to bring a local family into homeownership.

Please join us as we learn more about Habitat for Humanity and each other.

Please RSVP Yes only if you are at least 98% sure you will be attending.  If you are unable to attend but want to learn more and/or be added to the email list please email your contact information (name, email, town) to the email address listed below.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Habitat for Humanity Braintree Area LPC August Community Meeting!

Wednesday, August 8th @ 7pm-8:30pm

Braintree Community Youth Center (BCYC)

74 Pond StreetBraintree, MA

W: www.sshabitat.org

E: BraintreeLPC@sshabitat.org

Meeting Location: BCYC, located on the 2nd floor

Event Host(s)/Organizer(s): Angela

Min/Max: All are welcome!  Since the room capacity is 60 people we will set the maximum for this group at 20 people.

Guests: Welcome, please keep it to one per person.

Fees/Costs: None, unless we go out for a bite to eat afterwards.  Please bring cash to pay for your food and beverages if so.

RSVP Deadline: Wednesday, August 8th @ 3pm

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Directions to the Braintree Community Youth Center (BCYC) located @ 74 Pond Street, Braintree, MA:

Overview: The BCYC is located on Pond Street, approximately 1 mile from Braintree High School and the T and highway. It is one of two brick buildings next to a cemetery across from Sunset Lake.
From Routes 24/95/128/93: Head towards Route 3 South/Braintree/Cape Cod.

From Route 3: Take Exit 17/Union Street, Braintree.  Exit the Rotary heading towards the T and Bickford's and South Braintree.  Go straight through the 1st light keeping the T on your left.  Go up the hill and take a left at the next light onto Washington Street.  Follow straight thru 2 sets of lights passing Town Hall on your right.  At the next set of lights take a right, which is still Washington Street.  (Rite-Aid is at this intersection.  It will be to your left at the light and behind you after you make the turn.)  Take a left at the next light (onto Route 37S) keeping Braintree Cooperative Bank on your left.  Take a right at the next light onto Pond Street.  74 Pond Street is 1/4 mile up on the left next to a cemetery.  It is one of two brick buildings.  Park on the side.


From the Braintree T: Follow directions above on foot.

group.name: South Shore Hike, Bike & Social Club

item.name: South Shore Habitat for Humanity Braintree Area LPC August Community Meeting!
